intro: Pasania amygdalifolia, commonly known as the almond-leaved pasania, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small to medium-sized shrub characterized by its aromatic, ovate leaves that resemble those of almond trees. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several small, round seeds. Pasania amygdalifolia is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
